facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_042539/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of publications per year
yearly_publications = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_publications.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), title='Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the trend data
print("### Begin of facts")
print(yearly_publications)
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_042539/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of publications per year
yearly_publications = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_publications.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), title='Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the trend data
print("### Begin of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_042539/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of publications per year
yearly_publications = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_publications.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), title='Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the trend data
print("### Begin of facts")
print(yearly_publications)
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common research methods and tools used in sensemaking publications over the years covered in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_042539/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of publications per year
yearly_publications = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_publications.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), title='Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the trend data
print("### Begin of facts")
print(yearly_publications)
print("### End of facts")
